alert.note: Alert for Central Washington; Coastal Hancock; Coastal Washington; Interior Hancock; Southern Penobscot (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 27 at 6:58PM EST until January 30 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY MORNING THROUGH SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions possible. Total snow accumulations of 10 to 16 inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 55 mph. * WHERE...Portions of Coastal DownEast, Interior DownEast and Penobscot Valley Maine. * WHEN...From Saturday morning through Sunday morning. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Travel could be extremely dangerous. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility and cause localized hazardous travel. Strong winds could cause damage to trees and powerlines.
info.instruction: A Winter Storm Watch for blizzard conditions means there is a potential for falling and/or blowing snow with strong winds and extremely poor visibilities. This can lead to whiteout conditions and make travel very dangerous.

area.areaDesc: Central Washington; Coastal Hancock; Coastal Washington; Interior Hancock; Southern Penobscot
